reviewText: great film for anyone, but mostly for fans of Britnoir (if there is such a thing).
IT'S BEEN A LONG TIME SINCE I FIRST SAW THIS MOVIE IT WAS GREAT TO SEE IT AGAIN & AGAIN, THANK YOU. JOHN

Nostalgia Family has done it again! I've purchased several DVDs from this company mainly because I couldn't find the films elsewhere (most are British titles that are not available on region 1 format), and the transfer quality has been good, and sometimes great. This DVD transfer is superb. The overall video quality is excellent---no static, no picture jitters, no blurriness; the contrast is fine---no washouts. This DVD has none of those problems, and the audio is great as well. I'm really impressed with most of the titles coming from Nostalgia Family.
A very good slice-of-life British film. Well worth the time spent in watching it.
Score by George Auric, one of the French group of composers known as "The Six". Very film noir as you might expect from the title.
love those kitchen sink British movies

This film out of Ealing Studios kept me engrossed all the way. The story line of one family and their encounters with some not so savory  types is all quite believable for the time. Each family member having their own problems, which, by the end of the film all ties together and clears up in one fell swoop by the police.

Better and more compelling than most modern dramas. There's a stunningly beautiful chase through a rail yard toward the end which would not be nearly so striking and effective in color as it is in black and white.
